articles.title: Congratulations to Maltese FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Maltese FM
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message on Dec. 3 to Francis Zammit Dimech upon his appointment as foreign minister of Malta. 
					The message expressed the belief that the bilateral friendly ties would develop on good terms, wishing him success in his new job.

articles.title: Nigerian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Nigerian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Nigerian Investment Promotion Commission led by Executive Secretary Mustafa Bello visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					The members of the delegation looked round historic relics preserved at the old home with good care, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					Meanwhile, the delegation toured the Tower of the Juche Idea and the International Friendship Exhibition.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Family members of Kim Sun Ok, a Korean resident in China related to the Anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Sunday.
					They laid a floral basket before the statues before paying tribute to them in deep reverence.

articles.title: Round-table Talks Held in Japan on Anniversary of DPRK-Japan Sport Interchange
articles.content:
Round-table Talks Held in Japan on Anniversary of DPRK-Japan Sport Interchange
Tokyo, December 8 (KNS-KCNA) -- There took place round-table talks in Sinjuku Ward, Tokyo Metropolis on Nov. 27 to mark the 40th anniversary of the realization of the DPRK-Japan sport exchange.
					Present there were officials of the Korean Amateur Athletes Federation in Japan and members of the delegation of University of Sports of Japan who visited the DPRK.
					
					Kim Ro Hyon, chairman of the federation, recalled that the Japanese delegation deepened exchange with Pyongyang University of Physical Education through judo, football and wrestling matches in November last.
					
					He called for paving a road for improving the DPRK-Japan relations through sport exchange. 
					
					Kenshiro Matsunami, managing director of the Japanese university, made a report on its delegation's visit to the DPRK. Then followed speeches.
					
					They noted that the recent visit offered an occasion of warming the friendship between the two countries.
					
					Pointing out that Japanese students had an opportunity to know well about the DPRK, they underscored the need to promote exchange and friendship between the two countries through sports in the days ahead.
					
					At the round-table talks there was a briefing on the history of sport exchange between the two countries and the background against which the Federation for the Promotion of Sport Exchange between Japan and the DPRK was formed, and its activities.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea Launch Joint Exercises Stimulating Nuclear Crisis on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea Launch Joint Exercises Stimulating Nuclear Crisis on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCMA) -- The U.S. and south Korean warmongers started joint military exercises stimulating a nuclear crisis on the Korean Peninsula in New Mexico State of the U.S. on Dec. 6.
					They advertised that the objective of the exercises was to examine means for counter-deterrence, pursuant to a scenario of nuclear threat on the peninsula.  
					
					Such drills have been annual events since last year according to the decision made at their 2010 confab.
					
					They have become evermore reckless in their moves to bring the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korea's Co-sponsorship of "Resolution on Human Rights in North Korea" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea's Co-sponsorship of "Resolution on Human Rights in North Korea" under Fire
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the south Korean authorities cosponsored the "Resolution on Human Rights in North Korea" proposed by such forces hostile to the DPRK as the U.S. and the Japanese reactionaries at the Third Committee of the UN General Assembly.
					Minju Joson Sunday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					The UN "resolution" is a product of the conspiratorial plot hatched by the hostile forces to do harm to the DPRK.
					
					There can be no such "human rights issue" in the DPRK where the policy of believing in people as in Heaven is enforced, guided by the great Juche idea.
					
					This is unanimously recognized by any visitor to the DPRK.
					
					Only those who have not been to the country are seeking to do harm to the country with lies and fabrications but such trick can never work.
					
					South Korea has turned into the worst tundra of human rights in the world.
					
					That was why the UN recently adopted again a resolution urging the south Korean regime to repeal the "Security Law".
					
					It is brazen-faced for the Lee Myung Bak group to dare talk about "human rights" in the DPRK though it has ruthlessly violated even the right of the south Korean people to existence, far from guaranteeing them democratic freedom and rights. 
					
					It is the ulterior intention of the group to cover up its criminal act of turning south Korea into a tundra of human rights by misleading the public opinion and, at the same time, tarnish the daily rising international prestige of the DPRK, justify its moves to escalate the confrontation and realize international cooperation in the anti-DPRK campaign.

articles.title: Warship "Cheonan" Was Sunk Due to Its Running on Rock: S. Korean Marine
articles.content:
Warship "Cheonan" Was Sunk Due to Its Running on Rock: S. Korean Marine
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that the south Korean marine corps confirmed right after the occurrence of the "Cheonan" warship sinking that it was sunk due to its running on a rock.
					The then corporal of the 6th company of the 62nd battalion of the 6th brigade of the marine corps, Kim Sung Chang, testified to this fact at a hearing of the Seoul Central District Court.
					
					When asked if he saw any water column, he said "No". 
					
					He said while he was on duty at a coastal post west of Paekryong Island, he just watched white gleam appearing before him with a bang and disappearing before judging it was a thunder and reported this to the company. 
					
					He recalled he testified to the fact before the joint investigation team right after the occurrence of the incident.
					
					After hearing the news from the company that the warship hit a rock, he turned a searchlight on the sinking warship as instructed.  
					
					Conveying this fact, south Korean media said it was confirmed the warship, the command of the 2nd fleet, the joint chiefs of staff and even the marine corps were aware that the warship sank due to stranding.

articles.title: Disclosure of Truth about Secret Dealings with U.S. Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Disclosure of Truth about Secret Dealings with U.S. Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued a commentary on Nov. 27 demanding the disclosure of the truth about secret dealings between traitor Lee Myung Bak and the U.S.
					The commentary referred to endless stories now afloat in south Korea that Lee Myung Bak has had a lot of secret dealings with the U.S. during his office.
					
					Right after his coming to power Lee totally allowed the imports of  U.S. beef at the talks with the U.S. chief executive, the commentary disclosed, adding that right before the "presidential" inauguration he discussed the matter with the U.S. ambassador to south Korea.
					
					Recalling that the Lee Myung Bak "government" badly needed the help of the U.S. as regards the "Cheonan" warship incident in 2010, etc., the commentary noted that Lee renegotiated even the articles which were hurdles in the U.S. way of concluding the "Free Trade Agreement." 
					
					The dealing which Lee tried to hastily clinch for the conclusion of FTA in return for the U.S. gesture of hushing up BBK stock price fabrication was disclosed by U.S. media, the commentary said, and continued:
					
					The military field remains skeptical. After the first round of talks with the U.S. chief executive, Lee cried out for strengthening the 21st century strategic alliance. The then U.S. secretary of State pressurized south Korea to make a decision on its involvement in the missile defense system, the introduction of U.S.-made weapons, dispatch of troops overseas and increase of the upkeep for the U.S. forces in south Korea. This is just the tip of the iceberg of Lee's secret dealings with the U.S. 
					
					There is the  story that the Lee regime signed a contract on the purchase of U.S-made weapons in a bid to fill up the gap in the U.S. defense spending to the tune of 14 000 billion won caused due to its economic crisis.
					
					The commentary urged Lee Myung Bak and the U.S. chief executive to thoroughly probe the truth about the above-said dealings.

articles.title: Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Belarus
articles.content:
Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Belarus
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Belarus on Dec. 4. 
					L. Shukolinikov, chairman of the Permanent Committee of the Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named after Kim Il Sung, was elected chairman of the committee. 
					
					The committee decided to organize diverse events, including remembrance meeting, seminar and lecture, and widely introduce the undying feats of Kim Jong Il through publications to mark the first anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Personages
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting and a photo exhibition took place in the Czech Republic and a remembrance meeting in Bangladesh on Dec. 1 and 3 in the run-up to the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Displayed in the venue of the photo exhibition were photos showing the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Present at the meetings were personages of different social standings including the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party who is chairman of the Czechoslovak Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist－Leninist) who is minister of Industry of Bangladesh, the  chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers’ Party of Bangladesh, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh and the chairman of the Bangladesh－Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee and masses.
					
					Miroslav Stepan, chairman of the Czechoslovak Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il, said:
					
					Kim Jong Il carried forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung, performing immortal feats in the efforts to accomplish the cause of socialism in the long period of leading the Korean revolution.
					
					He defended and further developed socialism with his Songun politics in the 1990's, in particular, when the imperialists went to extremes in their moves to stifle the DPRK. He thus instilled great confidence and courage into all of us.
					
					The speakers at the remembrance meeting in Bangladesh praised Kim Jong Il as an outstanding politician who developed in depth the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and led the cause of global independence and the anti-imperialist struggle to victory through his Songun leadership.
					
					The DPRK could firmly defend the national sovereignty from all forms of sanctions and moves of the imperialists to stifle it thanks to his Songun politics, they added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by British Public Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by British Public Figure
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, posted an article on its internet website on Nov. 26 in the run-up to the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					In an article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il, great guardian of independence, Songun and socialism" the chairman said Kim Jong Il resolutely frustrated the imperialists' ever-more desperate moves against the DPRK at the end of the last century with a treasured sword of Songun. 
					
					It was thanks to the outstanding Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK could shed its rays as a dignified socialist military power of Juche in the East, he said, and went on:
					
					Kim Jong Il published a lot of famous works to protect socialism from the ideological offensive of the imperialists and renegades. 
					
					Independence, Songun and socialist line consistently maintained by Kim Jong Il are great legacies bequeathed by him. 
					
					The image of Kim Jong Il is shining brightly and he is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and other progressive people of the world desirous of independence and socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Democratic Congo, Zimbabwe
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Democratic Congo,Zimbabwe
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place at the building of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo and at Kuwazana Primary School No. 2 of Zimbabwe on Nov. 30 in the run-up to the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					The general secretary of the C. C., Communist Party of Democratic Congo said in the whole period of his life Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to strengthen the Workers' Party of Korea and fully meet the requirements of the Juche idea in its activities. 
					
					Thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il, the Korean people could resolutely frustrate the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK and bring about a turning phase in building a thriving nation, he said, and went on:
					
					All facts clearly proved before the whole world that the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il serves as an invincible treasured sword for accomplishing the cause of socialism. 
					
					The principal of the primary school of Zimbabwe said Kim Jong Il was a genius of ideas and theories and a great master of leadership. 
					
					Over half a century he wisely led the party, army and people of the DPRK, performing immortal exploits before the times and history, the principal said, adding:
					
					The great Kim Jong Il is always with us.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by British Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by British Organizations
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on Nov. 27 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of his inspection of the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army (KPA). 
					The statement said:
					
					Panmunjom is the place symbolic of Korea's division caused by foreign forces. It was here that the U.S. imperialists recognized their defeat in the Korean War and signed the Armistice Agreement and it is the place where socialism and imperialism stand against each other with arms. 
					
					One can hardly visit the place without matchless courage and bold decision because it is exposed to constant threat of the U.S. imperialist and south Korean puppet soldiers. 
					
					However, Kim Jong Il inspected the Panmunjom Mission without any fear of the enemies, demonstrating the ardent wishes of himself and all other Koreans to put the earliest possible end to the country's division. 
					
					The dear respected Supreme Commander of the KPA Kim Jong Un also inspected Panmunjom in March this year, striking terror into the hearts of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers. 
					
					It is our belief that Kim Jong Un will surely achieve Korea's reunification in the near future, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Nigerian Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong U's Work Introduced by Nigerian Internet Website
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) --A detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Our Social Sciences Should Actively Contribute to Accomplishing the Cause of Modeling Whole Society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism" was posted on the internet website of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on Dec. 2.
					The work published on Dec. 1, 2012 says that the Academy of Social Sciences has firmly upheld the ideas and authority of the Workers' Party of Korea and the leader and contributed to the development of its ideas and theories and the accomplishment of the Juche revolutionary cause and indicates the main duty facing the field of social sciences at present.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked in Peru
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Peru
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il made public a statement on Dec. 3 to mark the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, the 21st anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army, the first anniversary of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA and the 95th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					It said that Kim Jong Il was a brilliant Songun commander of Mt. Paektu who was born in a revolutionary family of Mt. Paektu and grew, hearing gun reports during the anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					He was the great leader of the world revolution who successfully led the cause of Juche, Songun cause, instilling strength and courage into the progressives in their struggle for independence and unity. 
					
					The idea and cause of Kim Jong Il have been successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					Under his Songun leadership the Korean people will surely win a final victory in the effort for building a thriving nation and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					We extend glory to the great men of Mt. Paektu who made tremendous contributions to socialism and the cause of global independence and the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un victoriously leading the drive for the prosperity of Songun Korea, true to their intentions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Bulgaria
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association released its bulletin No. 9 on Dec. 3 to mark the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, the 21st anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the first anniversary of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA.
					The bulletin carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il. 
					
					In an article "First Anniversary of Demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il" the bulletin said he devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people. 
					
					In another article titled "Kim Jong Il's Efforts for Reunification of Korea" the bulletin said:
					
					Kim Jong Il made a bold decision to provide a summit between the north and the south which had been in the relationship of hostility and confrontation for more than half a century. 
					
					The north-south summit, the first of its kind in the history of the Korean nation, was held in June of 2000 and the June 15 joint declaration called milestone for the reunification of Korea was adopted. 
					
					Kim Jong Il provided another north-south summit in October of 2007 which culminated in the adoption of the October 4 declaration, a program for implementing the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					The June 15 joint declaration, a permanent banner for Korea's reunification, and the October 4 declaration reinforce the Korean nation's will to achieve reunification.
